summary: In 1804, Meriwether Lewis and William Clark led an expedition to explore the western United States after the Louisiana Purchase. They traveled from Illinois up the Missouri River, crossed the Continental Divide, and reached the Pacific Ocean in 1805. The journey aimed to map the new territory, find a route to the ocean, and establish American presence before Europeans. They also studied nature, geography, and traded with Native American tribes. The expedition returned safely in 1806, sharing their discoveries with President Jefferson.
title: Lewis and Clark Expedition
